page.title: 02The FIVE BELLS Public House
page.content: The{"Five Bells"}is situated in Ringwould, on the A258. The Landlord,{Charles Rowney,}is an ex-fireman and has owned the pub for two years. His wife cooks the meals which are served in the bar. Mr Rowney says that his regular customers come from Mongeham, Deal and St. Margarets. Few villagers seem to use the pub. There are neither children's facilities nor garden at present, but these are planned for the near future. The Landlord says his most popular drink is Bass, a premium bitter beer. The opening hours are from 10.30am to 2.30pm and from 6pm to 11pm on Mondays to Saturdays, and on Sunday from 12pm to 2pm and 7pm to 10.30pm. Two occasional bar staff are employed and there are public and saloon bars.
